00022 /**
00023  * @file   QuantBRLMM.cpp
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Fri Feb 24 11:02:09 2006
00026  *
00027  * Implements a SNP genotype calling method motivated by Nusrat Rabbee's
00028  * RLMM (Robust Linear Model with Mahalanobis Distance Classifier) that utilizes
00029  * a Baysian prior about the centers of SNP clusters. Idea is to produce a
00030  * summary value for all probes that measure same genotype (default using RMA to
00031  * summarize) and then classify the genotype based on the relative intensity of
00032  * those estimates. For example in genotype AA the A probesets should be
00033  * relatively bright and B probesets should be relatively dim. For genotype AB
00034  * both probesets should be lighting up. Exactly how much intensity is expected
00035  * is learned from a random set of SNPs in the data using high confidence DM
00036  * calls as reference.
00037  *
00038  * For further information about RLMM see:
00039  * http://www.stat.berkeley.edu/users/nrabbee/RLMM/
00040  *
00041  */
00042

00044 #include "chipstream/QuantBRLMM.h"

00061 QuantBRLMM::BrlmmParam::BrlmmParam() {
00062   m_HetMultiplier = 1;
00063   m_Iterations = 0;
00064   m_IterationThreshold = 0.6;
00065   m_K = 1;
00066   m_PriorPseudoCount = 20;
00067   m_Transform = MvA;
00068   m_MinCluster = 2;
00069   m_LowPrecision = false;
00070 }
00071 
00072 /** Constructor, currently creates prior estimates from pre-calculated data from R. */
00073 QuantBRLMM::QuantBRLMM(double hetMultiplier, int iterations, double iterationThreshold,
00074                        double K, enum QuantBRLMM::Transformation transform,
00075                        int priorWeight, int priorMinCall, bool lowPrecision) {
00076   m_Param.m_HetMultiplier = hetMultiplier;
00077   m_Param.m_Iterations = iterations;
00078   m_Param.m_K = K;
00079   if (iterationThreshold < 0 || iterationThreshold > 1) {
00080     Err::errAbort("QuantBRLMM() - iter-thresh must be >= 0 and <= 1");
00081   }
00082   m_Param.m_IterationThreshold = iterationThreshold;
00083   if (transform > CCS || transform < MvA) {
00084     Err::errAbort("QuantBRLMM() - Expecting transform to be between: " + ToStr(MvA) + " (MvA) and: " +
00085                   ToStr(CCS) + " (CCS), but got: " + ToStr(transform));
00086   }
00087   if (priorWeight < 0) {
00088     Err::errAbort("QuantBRLMM() - Expecting a non-negative prior weight.");
00089   }
00090   m_Param.m_PriorPseudoCount = priorWeight;
00091   if (priorMinCall < 2) {
00092     Err::errAbort("QuantBRLMM() - Must have at least 2 examples per genotype for "
00093                   "use in prior generation. Current priorMinCall is: " + ToStr(priorMinCall));
00094   }
00095   m_Param.m_MinCluster = priorMinCall;
00096   m_Param.m_LowPrecision = lowPrecision;
00097   m_Param.m_Transform = transform;
00098   m_QuantMethod = NULL;
00099   m_Prior = NULL;
00100   m_CurrentPrior = NULL;
00101   m_BRLMMMaxScore = -1;
00102 
00103   setupSelfDoc(*this);
00104 
00105   setOptValue("het-mult", ToStr(m_Param.m_HetMultiplier));
00106   setOptValue("iterations", ToStr(m_Param.m_Iterations));
00107   setOptValue("iter-thresh", ToStr(m_Param.m_IterationThreshold));
00108   setOptValue("K", ToStr(m_Param.m_K));
00109   setOptValue("transform", stringForTransformation(m_Param.m_Transform));
00110   setOptValue("prior-weight", ToStr(m_Param.m_PriorPseudoCount));
00111   setOptValue("prior-mincall", ToStr(m_Param.m_MinCluster));
00112   setOptValue("lowprecision", m_Param.m_LowPrecision);
00113 }

00115 /** Fill in our self documentation from current state. */
00116 void QuantBRLMM::setupSelfDoc(SelfDoc &doc) {
00117   doc.setDocName(QUANTBRLMM);
00118   doc.setDocDescription("Do genotyping calls using the BRLMM (Bayesian RLMM) algorithm.");
00119   doc.setDocOptions(getDefaultDocOptions());
00120 }

00122 /** Destructor. */
00123 QuantBRLMM::~QuantBRLMM() {
00124   if (m_SnpModelsTsv.is_open()) {
00125     m_SnpModelsTsv.close();
00126   }
00127   if (m_DmCallsTsv.is_open()) {
00128     m_DmCallsTsv.close();
00129   }
00130   for (std::vector<QuantMethodReport *>::iterator it = m_Reporters.begin(); it != m_Reporters.end(); it++)
00131     {
00132       delete *it;
00133     }
00134   m_Reporters.clear();
00135   Freez(m_QuantMethod);
00136 }

00146 void QuantBRLMM::transformData(std::vector<double> &aVals,
00147                                std::vector<double> &bVals,
00148                                QuantBRLMM::BrlmmParam &param) {
00149   assert(aVals.size() == bVals.size());
00150   double x = 0, y = 0;
00151   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < aVals.size(); i++) {
00152     valueForTransformation(aVals[i], bVals[i], param.m_Transform, param.m_K, x, y);
00153     aVals[i] = x;
00154     bVals[i] = y;
00155   }
00156 }

00163 void QuantBRLMM::setPrior(const ClusterPrior &prior) {
00164   delete m_Prior;
00165   m_Prior = new ClusterPrior();
00166   m_Prior->id = prior.id;
00167   m_Prior->covars = prior.covars;
00168   m_Prior->centers = prior.centers;
00169   m_Prior->centerVars = prior.centerVars;
00170 }

00229 /**
00230  * Get our confidence value for a particular call in a particular sample.
00231  * @param index - sample of interest.
00232  * @return - Confidence in the predicted call.
00233  */
00234 double QuantBRLMM::getConfidence(unsigned int index) {
00235   if (index >= m_Confidences.size()) {
00236     Err::errAbort("Asking for call at index " + ToStr(index) + " when Probeset " +
00237                   m_ProbesetName + " has only " + ToStr(m_Confidences.size()) + " calls.");
00238   }
00239   return m_Confidences[index];
00240 }
00241 
00242 /**
00243  * Get our confidence value for a particular call in a particular sample.
00244  * @param genoType -  Genotype of interest.
00245  * @param index - sample of interest.
00246  * @return - Confidence in the predicted call.
00247  */
00248 double QuantBRLMM::getConfGenotype(affx::GType  genoType, unsigned int index) {
00249   assert(index < m_Distances.size());
00250   if (genoType == affx::NN)
00251     return FLT_MAX;
00252   return m_Distances[index][genoType];
00253 }

00255 /**
00256  * Get the summary value after transformation for the A and B alleles respectively.
00257  *
00258  * @param index - Which chip to get values for.
00259  * @param aValue - Filled in with transformed a value.
00260  * @param bValue - Filled in with transformed b value.
00261  */
00262 void QuantBRLMM::getAlleleValues(unsigned int index, double &aValue, double &bValue) {
00263   assert(index < m_AValues.size());
00264   assert(m_AValues.size() == m_BValues.size());
00265   aValue = m_AValues[index];
00266   bValue = m_BValues[index];
00267 }

00350 bool QuantBRLMM::prepare(const IntensityMart &iMart) {
00351   bool result = true;
00352   for (int i=0; i<m_Reporters.size(); i++)
00353     result = result && m_Reporters[i]->prepare(*this, iMart);
00354   return result;
00355 }
00356 
00357 bool QuantBRLMM::finish() {
00358   bool result = true;
00359   for (int i=0; i<m_Reporters.size(); i++)
00360     result = result && m_Reporters[i]->finish(*this);
00361   return result;
00362 }
00363 
00364 /**
00365  * @brief Do the heavy lifting of estimation.
00366  */
00367 void QuantBRLMM::computeEstimate() {
00368   transformData(m_AValues, m_BValues, m_Param);
00369   ClusterPrior *prior = priorForSnp();
00370   if (m_HaploidSnps.find(m_ProbesetName) == m_HaploidSnps.end()) {
00371     ClusterModel model;
00372     /* Check to see if there is a precomputed model. */
00373     if (!m_SnpModelMap.empty()) {
00374       std::map<std::string,ClusterModel>::iterator iter;
00375       iter = m_SnpModelMap.find(m_ProbesetName + "-2");
00376       if (iter == m_SnpModelMap.end()) {
00377         Err::errAbort("Can't find model for SNP: " + m_ProbesetName);
00378       }
00379       model = iter->second;
00380     }
00381     else {
00382       model = fitModel(m_AValues, m_BValues, m_Distances,
00383                        m_InitialCalls, *prior, m_ProbesetName, m_Param);
00384     }
00385     /* If we are saving models write this one out. */
00386     if (m_SnpModelsTsv.is_open()) {
00387       writeModelOut(model,m_SnpModelsTsv, m_ProbesetName, 2);
00388     }
00389     brlmmCall(m_AValues, m_BValues, model, m_Calls, m_Confidences, m_Distances, m_Param);
00390   }
00391   else {
00392     callHaploidSnp(*prior);
00393   }
00394 }
00395 
00396 /**
00397  * Remove the het cluster from a prior by setting center to be very
00398  * large negative number and removing covariance with other
00399  * clusters.
00400  * @param prior - Prior to remove het cluster from.
00401  * @param trans - transformation used for clustering.
00402  */
00403 void QuantBRLMM::removeHetFromPrior(ClusterPrior &prior, enum QuantBRLMM::Transformation trans) {
00404 
00405   /* Adjust het center to very large negative number. */
00406   if (trans == MvA) {
00407     prior.centers.element(2) = -1 * FLT_MAX; // -5000 in R code.
00408     prior.centers.element(3) = 0;
00409   }
00410   else if (trans == RvT || trans == CCS || trans == CES) {
00411     prior.centers.element(2) = 0;
00412     prior.centers.element(3) = -1 * FLT_MAX; // -5000 in R code
00413   }
00414   else {
00415     Err::errAbort("QuantBRLMM::removeHetFromPrior() - Don't recognize transform type: " + ToStr(trans));
00416   }
00417 
00418   /* cancel het covariance with other centers. */
00419   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < prior.covars.Nrows(); i++) {
00420     prior.covars.element(i,2) = 0;
00421     prior.covars.element(2,i) = 0;
00422     prior.covars.element(i,3) = 0;
00423     prior.covars.element(3,i) = 0;
00424   }
00425 
00426   /* make hets not vary particularly much, .01 comes directly from R code. */
00427   prior.covars.element(2,2) = .01;
00428   prior.covars.element(3,3) = .01;
00429 }
00430 
00431 /**
00432  * This is the fix for the snps on chromosome X that don't appear
00433  * diploid in men (i.e. aren't in the pseudoautosomal region). The
00434  * concept is to fit and call the model separately for men and
00435  * women. Implementation is to set all the male initial calls to NN
00436  * when fitting for women. For fitting and calling men the female
00437  * samples are set to NN and further the prior is ajusted such that
00438  * het calls are impossible to get.
00439  */
00440 void QuantBRLMM::callHaploidSnp(ClusterPrior &prior) {
00441   vector<affx::GType> xxCalls, xyCalls;
00442   vector<double> xxConfidences, xyConfidences;
00443   vector<vector<double> > xxDistances, xyDistances;
00444   vector<affx::GType> xxInitCalls(m_InitialCalls), xyInitCalls(m_InitialCalls);
00445   ClusterModel model;
00446   std::map<std::string,ClusterModel>::iterator iter;
00447   /* Sanity check. */
00448   Err::check(m_Genders.size() == m_InitialCalls.size(),
00449              "Error: QuantBRLMM::callHaploidSnp() - m_Gender and m_InitialCalls are different sizes.");
00450 
00451   /* Do the female fitting and calls. */
00452   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_InitialCalls.size(); i++) {
00453     if (m_Genders[i] == affx::Male) {
00454       xxInitCalls[i] = NN;
00455     }
00456   }
00457   ClusterModel xxModel;
00458   /* Check to see if there is a precomputed model. */
00459   if (!m_SnpModelMap.empty()) {
00460     string name = m_ProbesetName + "-2";
00461     iter = m_SnpModelMap.find(name);
00462     if (iter == m_SnpModelMap.end()) {
00463       Err::errAbort("Can't find model for SNP: " + m_ProbesetName + "-2");
00464     }
00465     xxModel = iter->second;
00466   }
00467   else {
00468     xxModel = fitModel(m_AValues, m_BValues, xxDistances,
00469                  xxInitCalls, prior, m_ProbesetName, m_Param);
00470 
00471   }
00472   /* If we are saving models write this one out. */
00473   if (m_SnpModelsTsv.is_open()) {
00474     writeModelOut(xxModel, m_SnpModelsTsv, m_ProbesetName, 2);
00475   }
00476   brlmmCall(m_AValues, m_BValues, xxModel, xxCalls, xxConfidences, xxDistances, m_Param);
00477 
00478   /* Do the male fitting and calls. */
00479   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_InitialCalls.size(); i++) {
00480       if (m_Genders[i] == affx::Female || m_Genders[i] == affx::UnknownGender) {
00481       xyInitCalls[i] = NN;
00482     }
00483   }
00484   ClusterPrior xyPrior = prior;
00485   /* This is where we adjust the prior to remove het cluster. */
00486   removeHetFromPrior(xyPrior, m_Param.m_Transform);
00487   /* Then fit as we usually would. */
00488   ClusterModel xyModel;
00489   /* Check to see if there is a precomputed model. */
00490   if (!m_SnpModelMap.empty()) {
00491     string name = m_ProbesetName + "-1";
00492     iter = m_SnpModelMap.find(name);
00493     if (iter == m_SnpModelMap.end()) {
00494       Err::errAbort("Can't find model for SNP: " + m_ProbesetName + "-1");
00495     }
00496     xyModel = iter->second;
00497   }
00498   else {
00499     xyModel = fitModel(m_AValues, m_BValues, xyDistances,
00500                        xyInitCalls, xyPrior, m_ProbesetName, m_Param);
00501   }
00502   /* If we are saving models write this one out. */
00503   if (m_SnpModelsTsv.is_open()) {
00504     writeModelOut(xyModel, m_SnpModelsTsv, m_ProbesetName, 1);
00505   }
00506   brlmmCall(m_AValues, m_BValues, xyModel, xyCalls, xyConfidences, xyDistances, m_Param);
00507 
00508   m_Calls.resize(xyCalls.size());
00509   m_Confidences.resize(xyConfidences.size());
00510   m_Distances.resize(xyDistances.size());
00511   /* fill in the results appropriate for each gender. */
00512   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_Genders.size(); i++) {
00513       if (m_Genders[i] == affx::Female || m_Genders[i] == affx::UnknownGender) {
00514       m_Calls[i] = xxCalls[i];
00515       m_Confidences[i] = xxConfidences[i];
00516       m_Distances[i] = xxDistances[i];
00517     }
00518     else if (m_Genders[i] == affx::Male) {
00519       m_Calls[i] = xyCalls[i];
00520       m_Confidences[i] = xyConfidences[i];
00521       m_Distances[i] = xyDistances[i];
00522     }
00523     else {
00524       Err::errAbort("QuantBRLMM::callHaploidSnp() - Don't recognize gender: " + ToStr(m_Genders[i]));
00525     }
00526   }
00527 }
00528 
00529 /**
00530  * Write out a text representation of the prior to the file specified.
00531  * @param prior - Prior to be written.
00532  * @param out - ostream to write to.
00533  */
00534 void QuantBRLMM::writePriorOut(ClusterPrior &prior, std::ostream &out,
00535                                const std::string& fieldDelim, const std::string& sep) {
00536   printColumnVector(prior.centers, &out, sep);
00537   out << fieldDelim;
00538   printColumnVector(prior.centerVars, &out, sep);
00539   out << fieldDelim;
00540   printMatrix(prior.covars, &out, sep);
00541   out << endl;
00542 }
00543 
00544 void QuantBRLMM::setSnpModelOut(const std::string& fileName,affx::TsvReport::TsvReportFmt_t format)
00545 {
00546   //
00547   // printf("### QuantBRLMM::setSnpModelOut('%s',%d)\n",fileName.c_str(),format);
00548   //
00549   m_SnpModelsTsv.setFilename(fileName);
00550   m_SnpModelsTsv.setFormat(format);
00551   //
00552   m_SnpModelsTsv.defineStringColumn(0,0,"probeset_id",TSVREPORT_PROBESET_STRLEN);
00553   m_SnpModelsTsv.defineColumn(0,1,"copy_number",affx::FILE5_DTYPE_INT);
00554   //
00555   m_SnpModelsTsv.defineStringColumn(0,2,"center",TSVREPORT_PROBESET_STRLEN);
00556   m_SnpModelsTsv.defineStringColumn(0,3,"var",TSVREPORT_PROBESET_STRLEN);
00557   // Add headers here.
00558   m_SnpModelsTsv.writeTsv_v1();
00559 }
00560 
00561 /**
00562  * Write out a text representation of the model to the file specified.
00563  * @param model - Model to be written.
00564  * @param out - ostream to write to.
00565  */
00566 void QuantBRLMM::writeModelOut(ClusterModel& model,affx::TsvReport& tsv, const std::string& name,int copies)
00567 {
00568   tsv.set_string(0,0,name); // "probeset_id"
00569   tsv.set_i(0,1,copies);    // "copy_number"
00570   //
00571   tsv.set_string(0,2,stringMatrix(model.clusterMeans,",")); // "center"
00572   tsv.set_string(0,3,stringMatrix(model.clusterVars, ",")); // "var"
00573   //
00574   tsv.writeLevel(0);
00575 }
00576 
00577 /**
00578  * Write out a text representation of the prior to the file specified.
00579  * @param prior
00580  * @param fileName
00581  */
00582 
00583 // Why is this singular
00584 void QuantBRLMM::writePrior(ClusterPrior &prior, const std::string& fileName) {
00585   std::string fieldDelim = "\t";
00586   std::string sep=",";
00587   ofstream out;
00588   Fs::mustOpenToWrite(out, fileName);
00589   out.setf(ios::fixed, ios::floatfield);
00590   out.precision(10);
00591   out << "center" << fieldDelim << "var" << fieldDelim << "center.var" << endl;
00592   QuantBRLMM::writePriorOut(prior, out, fieldDelim, sep);
00593 }
00594 
00595 /**
00596  * Covert string representations into ClusterPrior
00597  *
00598  * @param id - identifying string.
00599  * @param center - centers.
00600  * @param var - variance of center variances.
00601  * @param covar - covariance of centers.
00602  *
00603  * @return - ClusterPrior.
00604  */
00605 ClusterPrior QuantBRLMM::clusterPriorFromStrings(const std::string& fileName, std::string &id, std::string &center,
00606                                                  std::string &var, std::string &covar) {
00607   ClusterPrior prior;
00608   vector<double> vec;
00609   vector<string> words;
00610 
00611   prior.id = id;
00612 
00613   /* Read in the centers. */
00614   Util::chopString(center, ',', words);
00615   vec.clear();
00616   if (words.size() != 6)
00617     Err::errAbort("Expecting 6 entires in 'center' entry in file: " + ToStr(fileName) + " got: " + ToStr(words.size()));
00618   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < words.size(); i++) {
00619     vec.push_back(Convert::toDouble(words[i].c_str()));
00620   }
00621   prior.centers = columnVectorFromArray(&vec[0], (int)vec.size());
00622 
00623   /* Read in the variances. */
00624   Util::chopString(var, ',', words);
00625   vec.clear();
00626   if (words.size() != 9)
00627     Err::errAbort("Expecting 9 entires in 'var' entry in file: " + ToStr(fileName) + " got: " + ToStr(words.size()));
00628   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < words.size(); i++) {
00629     vec.push_back(Convert::toDouble(words[i].c_str()));
00630   }
00631   prior.centerVars = columnVectorFromArray(&vec[0], (int)vec.size());
00632 
00633   /* Do the covariacne matrix. */
00634   Util::chopString(covar, ',', words);
00635   vec.clear();
00636   if (words.size() != 36)
00637     Err::errAbort("Expecting 36 entires in 'centers.var' entry in file: " + ToStr(fileName) + " got: " + ToStr(words.size()));
00638   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < words.size(); i++) {
00639     vec.push_back(Convert::toDouble(words[i].c_str()));
00640   }
00641   prior.covars = matrixFromArray(&vec[0], (int)vec.size(), 6, 6);
00642   return prior;
00643 
00644 }
00645 
00646 /**
00647  * Covert string representations into ClusterModel
00648  *
00649  * @param id - identifying string.
00650  * @param center - centers.
00651  * @param var - variance of center variances.
00652  *
00653  * @return - ClusterModel
00654  */
00655 ClusterModel QuantBRLMM::clusterModelFromStrings(const std::string& fileName, std::string &id,
00656                                                  std::string &center, std::string &var) {
00657   ClusterModel model;
00658   vector<double> vec(9);
00659   vector<string> words;
00660   /* Read in the centers. */
00661   Util::chopString(center, ',', words);
00662   vec.clear();
00663   if (words.size() != 6)
00664     Err::errAbort("Expecting 6 entires in 'center' entry in file: " + ToStr(fileName) +
00665                   " got: " + ToStr(words.size()) + " for probest: " + id);
00666   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < words.size(); i++) {
00667     vec.push_back(Convert::toDouble(words[i].c_str()));
00668   }
00669   model.clusterMeans = matrixFromArray(&vec[0], (int)vec.size(), 6, 1);
00670 
00671   /* Read in the variances. */
00672   Util::chopString(var, ',', words);
00673   vec.clear();
00674   if (words.size() != 9)
00675     Err::errAbort("Expecting 9 entires in 'var' entry in file: " + ToStr(fileName) +
00676                   " got: " + ToStr(words.size()) + " for probest: " + id);
00677   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < words.size(); i++) {
00678     vec.push_back(Convert::toDouble(words[i].c_str()));
00679   }
00680   model.clusterVars = matrixFromArray(&vec[0], (int)vec.size(), 9, 1);
00681   return model;
00682 }
00683 
00684 
00685 /**
00686  * Read the prior from the test file specified.
00687  * @param fileName - Name of file to read from.
00688  * @return - The prior read in from file.
00689  */
00690 ClusterPrior QuantBRLMM::loadPrior(const std::string& fileName) {
00691   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00692   string center, centerVar, var, id="unknown";
00693   ClusterPrior prior;
00694   vector<double> vec;
00695   tsv.open(fileName);
00696   //tsv.bind(0,"id", &id, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00697   tsv.bind(0,"center", &center, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00698   tsv.bind(0,"var", &var, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00699   tsv.bind(0,"center.var", &centerVar, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00700   if (tsv.nextLevel(0) != affx::TSV_OK) {
00701     Err::errAbort("Didnt' get an entry in file: " + ToStr(fileName));
00702   }
00703   prior = QuantBRLMM::clusterPriorFromStrings(fileName, id, center, var, centerVar);
00704   tsv.close();
00705   return prior;
00706 }
00707 
00708 /**
00709  * Generate a string representation of a snp model.
00710  * @return string - text description of snp clusters.
00711  */
00712 std::string QuantBRLMM::getModelString() {
00713   int i = 0, j = 0;
00714   std::string s = m_ProbesetName;
00715   s += "\t";
00716   for (i = 0; i < m_CurrentPrior->centers.Nrows() - 1; i++) {
00717     s += ToStr(m_CurrentPrior->centers.element(i));
00718     s += ",";
00719   }
00720   s += ToStr(m_CurrentPrior->centers.element(i));
00721   s += "\t";
00722   for (i = 0; i < m_CurrentPrior->centerVars.Nrows() - 1; i++) {
00723     s += ToStr(m_CurrentPrior->centerVars.element(i));
00724     s += ",";
00725   }
00726   s += ToStr(m_CurrentPrior->centerVars.element(i));
00727   s += "\t";
00728   for (i = 0; i < m_CurrentPrior->covars.Nrows()-1; i++) {
00729     for (j = 0; j < m_CurrentPrior->covars.Ncols(); j++) {
00730       s += ToStr(m_CurrentPrior->covars.element(i,j));
00731       s += ",";
00732     }
00733   }
00734   for (j = 0; j < m_CurrentPrior->covars.Ncols() - 1; j++) {
00735     s += ToStr(m_CurrentPrior->covars.element(i,j));
00736     s += ",";
00737   }
00738   s += ToStr(m_CurrentPrior->covars.element(i,j));
00739   return s;
00740 }
00741 
00742 /**
00743  * Load in a number of snp specific models.
00744  * @param snpModels - map of snp probeset names to models.
00745  * @param fileName - filename to read models from.
00746  */
00747 void QuantBRLMM::loadSnpModels(std::map<std::string, ClusterModel> &snpModels,const std::string& fileName) {
00748   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00749   string center, var, id, copies;
00750   ClusterModel model;
00751   snpModels.clear();
00752   tsv.open(fileName);
00753 
00754   // we want to allow either "probeset_id" or "id"...
00755   int probeset_id_cidx;
00756   probeset_id_cidx=tsv.cname2cidx(0,"probeset_id","id");
00757   if (probeset_id_cidx<0) {
00758     Err::errAbort("QuantBRLMM::loadSnpModels: no 'probeset_id' or 'id' column");
00759   }
00760   int copy_number_cidx;
00761   copy_number_cidx=tsv.cname2cidx(0,"copy_number","copies");
00762   if (copy_number_cidx<0) {
00763     Err::errAbort("QuantBRLMM::loadSnpModels: no 'copy_number' or 'copies' column");
00764   }
00765   //
00766   tsv.bind(0,probeset_id_cidx, &id    , affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00767   tsv.bind(0,copy_number_cidx, &copies, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00768   tsv.bind(0,"center", &center, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00769   tsv.bind(0,"var", &var, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00770   //
00771   while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == affx::TSV_OK) {
00772     model = clusterModelFromStrings(fileName, id, center, var);
00773     if (snpModels.find(id) != snpModels.end()) {
00774       Err::errAbort("QuantBRLMM::loadSnpModels() - Id: " + ToStr(id) + " seen multiple times.");
00775     }
00776     snpModels[id + "-" + copies] = model;
00777   }
00778   tsv.close();
00779 }
00780 
00781 /**
00782  * Load in a number of snp specific priors.
00783  * @param snpPriors - map of snp probeset names to priors.
00784  * @param fileName - filename to read priors from.
00785  */
00786 void QuantBRLMM::loadSnpPriors(std::map<std::string,ClusterPrior> &snpPriors,
00787                                const std::string& fileName) {
00788   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00789   string center, centerVar, var, id="unknown";
00790   ClusterPrior prior;
00791   snpPriors.clear();
00792   tsv.open(fileName);
00793   tsv.bind(0,"id", &id, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00794   tsv.bind(0,"center", &center, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00795   tsv.bind(0,"var", &var, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00796   tsv.bind(0,"center.var", &centerVar, affx::TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00797   while (tsv.nextLevel(0) == affx::TSV_OK) {
00798     prior = clusterPriorFromStrings(fileName, id, center, var, centerVar);
00799     if (snpPriors.find(prior.id) != snpPriors.end()) {
00800       Err::errAbort("QuantBRLMM::loadSnpPriors() - Id: " + ToStr(prior.id) + " seen multiple times.");
00801     }
00802     snpPriors[prior.id] = prior;
00803   }
00804   tsv.close();
00805 }
00806 
00807 
00808 /**
00809  * Compute the prior from a collection of snps and fill in the prior.
00810  *
00811  * @param snpStats - Stats for a relatively large number of snps
00812  * @param prior - Fill in the prior.
00813  */
00814 void QuantBRLMM::computeClusterPrior(const std::vector<ClusterStats> &snpStats, ClusterPrior &prior) {
00815   vector<vector<double> > means(6);
00816   vector<vector<double> > vars(9);
00817   prior.snpCount = snpStats.size();
00818   /* Save up vectors of the values for calculating stats. */
00819   for (unsigned int snpIx = 0; snpIx < snpStats.size(); snpIx++) {
00820     const ClusterStats &stats = snpStats[snpIx];
00821     for (unsigned int meanIx = 0; meanIx < stats.means.size(); meanIx++) {
00822       means[meanIx].push_back(stats.means[meanIx]);
00823     }
00824     for (unsigned int varIx = 0; varIx < stats.vars.size(); varIx++) {
00825       vars[varIx].push_back(stats.vars[varIx]);
00826     }
00827   }
00828   prior.centers.ReSize(6);
00829   prior.centerVars.ReSize(9);
00830   prior.covars.ReSize(6,6);
00831   for (unsigned int meanIx = 0; meanIx < means.size(); meanIx++) {
00832     prior.centers.element(meanIx) = Average<vector<double>::iterator, double>()(means[meanIx].begin(),
00833                                                                                means[meanIx].end());
00834     for (unsigned int nIx = 0; nIx < means.size(); nIx++) {
00835       prior.covars.element(meanIx, nIx) = UnbiasedCovariance<vector<double>::iterator, double>()(means[meanIx].begin(),
00836                                                                                                 means[meanIx].end(),
00837                                                                                                 means[nIx].begin());
00838     }
00839   }
00840   for (unsigned int varIx = 0; varIx < vars.size(); varIx++)
00841     prior.centerVars.element(varIx) = Average<vector<double>::iterator, double>()(vars[varIx].begin(), vars[varIx].end());
00842 }
00843 
00844 /**
00845  * Construct a prior from a collection of probesets. Note that to be part of
00846  * the prior a SNP must have at least 2 examples per AA, AB, and BB otherwise
00847  * the variance will be zero.
00848  *
00849  * @param probeSets - ProbeSets to be used in computing prior.
00850  * @param layout - description and chip and probesets.
00851  * @param iMart - Cel file data for probesets.
00852  * @param iTrans - Transformers to operate on raw data (i.e. normalization and bg subtraction).
00853  * @param pmAdjust - Individual probe adjustment like pm-mm or pm-only.
00854  *
00855  * @return - Prior constructed from summary of all the probesets.
00856  */
00857 ClusterPrior QuantBRLMM::makePrior(std::vector<string>& probeSetNames,
00858                                    ChipLayout& layout,
00859                                    IntensityMart& iMart,
00860                                    std::vector<ChipStream *>& iTrans,
00861                                    PmAdjuster &pmAdjust)
00862 {
00863   ClusterPrior prior;
00864   vector<ClusterStats> snpStats;
00865   int minCalls = m_Param.m_MinCluster;
00866   Err::check(minCalls >= 2, "QuantBRLMM::makePrior() - Threshold must have at least two calls per genotype.");
00867   try {
00868     for (unsigned int psIx = 0; psIx < probeSetNames.size(); psIx++) {
00869       ProbeListPacked pList = layout.getProbeListByName(probeSetNames[psIx]);
00870       ///@todo deal with missing probes from kill list
00871       if (pList.isNull()) {
00872          Err::errAbort("QuantBRLMM::makePrior(): Cannot deal with missing probes from kill list");
00873       }
00874       ProbeSet *gtPs = ProbeListFactory::asProbeSet(pList);
00875       // Have to skip probesets that don't have 2 or 4 groups as it
00876       // appears that some are mislabelled in the cdf file.
00877       if (gtPs->psType != ProbeSet::GenoType || (gtPs->numGroups != 2 && gtPs->numGroups != 4))
00878         continue;
00879       m_AValues.clear();
00880       m_BValues.clear();
00881       /* Load up the postulated genotypes for this snp. */
00882       //map<string, vector<char> >::iterator mapIter = m_KnownGenoTypes.find(gtPs->name);
00883       KnownGenoTypes_iter_t mapIter = m_KnownGenoTypes.find(gtPs->name);
00884       if (mapIter == m_KnownGenoTypes.end()) {
00885         Err::errAbort("QuantBRLMM::makePrior() - Can't find genotype data for SNP: " + ToStr(gtPs->name));
00886       }
00887       vector<GType> &gType = mapIter->second;
00888       m_InitialCalls.clear();
00889       for (unsigned int i = 0; i < gType.size(); i++) {
00890         m_InitialCalls.push_back(gType[i]);
00891       }
00892       fillInAlleleProbeSets(*gtPs, m_Aallele, m_Ballele);
00893       if (!summarizeAllele(&m_Aallele, m_AValues, iMart, iTrans, pmAdjust, m_QuantMethod, m_Param.m_LowPrecision))
00894         Err::errAbort("Couldn't calculate A summary values for SNP: " + ToStr(gtPs->name));
00895       if (!summarizeAllele(&m_Ballele, m_BValues, iMart, iTrans, pmAdjust, m_QuantMethod, m_Param.m_LowPrecision))
00896         Err::errAbort("Couldn't calculate B summary values for SNP: " + ToStr(gtPs->name));
00897       transformData(m_AValues, m_BValues, m_Param);
00898       ClusterStats stats = computeClusterStats(m_AValues, m_BValues, m_InitialCalls,
00899                                                m_Param.m_Transform, m_Param.m_K);
00900       /* Only use these stats if there at least two data points per snp. */
00901       if (stats.counts.size() == 3 && stats.counts[0] >= minCalls &&
00902          stats.counts[1] >= minCalls && stats.counts[2] >= minCalls) {
00903         snpStats.push_back(stats);
00904       }
00905       delete gtPs;
00906     }
00907     computeClusterPrior(snpStats, prior);
00908   }
00909   catch(...) {
00910     Err::errAbort("exception while calculating prior.");
00911   }
00912   Verbose::out(1, ToStr(snpStats.size()) + " of " + ToStr(probeSetNames.size()) + " (" +
00913                ToStr((float)snpStats.size()/probeSetNames.size()*100.0) +
00914                "%) of SNPs had at least 2 observations per genotype.");
00915   return prior;
00916 }
00917 
00918 /**
00919  * @brief Set up the quantification method given all the data about the probe
00920  * set, chip layout and data.
00921  *
00922  * @param psGroup - Probes to be used for final estimate.
00923  * @param layout - Chip layout annotation.
00924  * @param iMart - Raw data from chips.
00925  * @param iTrans - Transformations to be applied to data before use.
00926  * @param pmAdjust - How to estimate background, or MM probe.
00927  * @return True if setup sucessful, false otherwise.
00928  */
00929 bool QuantBRLMM::setUp(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, const IntensityMart &iMart, 
00930                        std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, PmAdjuster &pmAdjust) {
00931   const ProbeSet *gtPs = NULL; // Genotyping probeset
00932   blankSelf(); // Make sure we clear out the past analysis before starting this one.
00933   bool success = true;
00934   /* Sanity checks about probesets. */
00935   if (psGroup.probeSets.empty())
00936     Err::errAbort("Zero probesets in ProbeSetGroup (group: " + ToStr(psGroup.name) + ").");
00937   /* Remember this probeset. */
00938   gtPs = psGroup.probeSets[0];
00939   m_GtProbeSet = gtPs;
00940   m_ProbesetName = gtPs->name;
00941   if (!canSetUpProbeSet(gtPs)) {return false;}
00942   if (psGroup.probeSets.size() > 1)
00943     Err::errAbort("Can't have multiple probesets in a genotyping ProbeSetGroup (group: " + ToStr(psGroup.name) + ").");
00944 
00945   /* Load up the postulated genotypes for this snp. */
00946   KnownGenoTypes_t::iterator mapIter = m_KnownGenoTypes.find(gtPs->name);
00947   if (mapIter == m_KnownGenoTypes.end()) {
00948     blankSelf();
00949     Verbose::out(2, "QuantBRLMM::setUp() - Can't find genotype data for SNP: (probeset: name=" + ToStr(gtPs->name) + ", type=" + ProbeSet::typeEnumToString(gtPs->psType) + ")");
00950     return false;
00951   }
00952   if (m_QuantMethod == NULL) {
00953     QuantMethodFactory factory(QuantMethodFactory::Expression);
00954     ChipLayout layout;
00955     string spec = "plier.optmethod=1";
00956     m_QuantMethod = factory.quantExprMethodForString(spec, layout, QuantMethodFactory::Expression);
00957   }
00958 
00959   vector<affx::GType> &gType = mapIter->second;
00960   m_InitialCalls.clear();
00961   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < gType.size(); i++) {
00962      m_InitialCalls.push_back(gType[i]);
00963    }
00964   fillInAlleleProbeSets(*gtPs, m_Aallele, m_Ballele);
00965 
00966   /* Get summaries for each allele. */
00967   success &= summarizeAllele(&m_Aallele, m_AValues, iMart, iTrans, pmAdjust,
00968                              m_QuantMethod, m_Param.m_LowPrecision, true, m_Reporters);
00969   if (gtPs->psType == ProbeSet::Copynumber) {
00970     blankSelf();
00971     return false;
00972   }
00973   success &= summarizeAllele(&m_Ballele, m_BValues, iMart, iTrans, pmAdjust,
00974                              m_QuantMethod, m_Param.m_LowPrecision, true, m_Reporters);
00975   //
00976   if (m_DmCallsTsv.is_open()) {
00977     m_DmCallsTsv.set_string(0,0,m_ProbesetName);
00978     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_InitialCalls.size(); i++) {
00979       m_DmCallsTsv.set_i(0,1+i,affx::GType_to_int(m_InitialCalls[i]));
00980     }
00981     m_DmCallsTsv.writeLevel(0);
00982   }
00983 
00984   if (!success)
00985     blankSelf();
00986   return success;
00987 }
00988 
00989 ClusterPrior *QuantBRLMM::priorForSnp() {
00990   if (m_SnpPriorMap.empty()) {
00991     m_CurrentPrior = m_Prior;
00992     return m_Prior;
00993   }
00994   else {
00995     std::map<std::string,ClusterPrior>::iterator mapIter = m_SnpPriorMap.find(m_ProbesetName);
00996     if (mapIter == m_SnpPriorMap.end()) {
00997       m_CurrentPrior = m_Prior;
00998       return m_Prior;
00999       //      Err::errAbort("QuantBRLMM::priorForSnp() - Can't find prior for SNP: " + m_ProbesetName);
01000     }
01001     m_CurrentPrior = &mapIter->second;
01002     return &mapIter->second;
01003   }
01004 }
01005 
01006 /** Conversion utility for transforming vectors to column vectors. */
01007 ColumnVector QuantBRLMM::columnVectorFromVector(std::vector<double> &v) {
01008   ColumnVector x;
01009   x.ReSize(v.size());
01010   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < v.size(); i++)
01011     x.element(i) = v[i];
01012   return x;
01013 }
01014 
01015 /** Conversion utility for transforming arrays to column vectors. */
01016 ColumnVector QuantBRLMM::columnVectorFromArray(double *array, int count) {
01017   ColumnVector x;
01018   x.ReSize(count);
01019   for (int i = 0; i < count; i++)
01020     x.element(i) = array[i];
01021   return x;
01022 }
01023 
01024 /** Conversion utility for transforming arrays to matrices. */
01025 Matrix QuantBRLMM::matrixFromArray(double *array, int count, int nRow, int nCol) {
01026   Matrix m(nRow, nCol);
01027   assert(nRow * nCol == count);
01028   for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
01029     int col = i / nRow;
01030     int row = i - col * nRow;
01031     m.element(row, col) = array[i];
01032   }
01033   return m;
01034 }
01035 
01036 
01037 /** Make banded count matrix. */
01038 Matrix QuantBRLMM::makeCountMat(std::vector<int> &counts) {
01039   Matrix m(6,6);
01040   m = 0;
01041   assert(counts.size() == 3);
01042   m.element(0,0) = counts[0];
01043   m.element(0,1) = counts[0];
01044   m.element(1,0) = counts[0];
01045   m.element(1,1) = counts[0];
01046 
01047   m.element(2,2) = counts[1];
01048   m.element(2,3) = counts[1];
01049   m.element(3,2) = counts[1];
01050   m.element(3,3) = counts[1];
01051 
01052   m.element(4,4) = counts[2];
01053   m.element(4,5) = counts[2];
01054   m.element(5,4) = counts[2];
01055   m.element(5,5) = counts[2];
01056   return m;
01057 }
01058 
01059 /** Reformat variance/covariance vector as a banded matrix. */
01060 Matrix QuantBRLMM::formatAsBigVarMat(ColumnVector v) {
01061   Matrix m(6, 6);
01062   m = 0;
01063   int nRows = v.Nrows();
01064   assert(nRows == 9);
01065   // Diagonal are m and a variances.
01066   m.element(0,0) = v.element(0);
01067   m.element(1,1) = v.element(1);
01068   m.element(2,2) = v.element(3);
01069   m.element(3,3) = v.element(4);
01070   m.element(4,4) = v.element(6);
01071   m.element(5,5) = v.element(7);
01072   // Fill in the covariances appropriately
01073   m.element(0,1) = m.element(1,0) = v.element(2);
01074   m.element(2,3) = m.element(3,2) = v.element(5);
01075   m.element(4,5) = m.element(5,4) = v.element(8);
01076   /// @todo what about other points like 1,3 or 1,5?
01077   return m;
01078 }
01079 
01080 /** Bayesian update of the mean vector, this is where the voodoo
01081     happens. Have to query Simon more about the motivation. */
01082 Matrix QuantBRLMM::bayesianMeanUpdate(ColumnVector &newVar, std::vector<int> &counts, ColumnVector &means,
01083                                              Matrix &priorCenterVar, ColumnVector &priorCenter) {
01084   Matrix sigmaInv = QuantBRLMM::formatAsBigVarMat(newVar);
01085   sigmaInv = sigmaInv.i();
01086   Matrix countMatrix = QuantBRLMM::makeCountMat(counts);
01087   Matrix centerVarInv = priorCenterVar.i();
01088   Matrix elementMult = elementMultiplication(countMatrix, sigmaInv);
01089   Matrix t1 = centerVarInv + elementMult;
01090   t1 = t1.i();
01091   Matrix t2 = centerVarInv * priorCenter;
01092   Matrix temp = elementMult * means;
01093   t2 = t2 + temp;
01094   Matrix newMean = t1 * t2;
01095   return newMean;
01096 }
01097 
01098 /// @todo should degFree be weight or counts rather than degrees of freedom?
01099 ColumnVector QuantBRLMM::shrinkVariance(ClusterStats &empirical, ClusterPrior &prior, int degFree) {
01100   ColumnVector newVar;
01101   newVar.ReSize(empirical.vars.size());
01102   /// @todo improve handling of NA rather than setting to zero
01103   for (int i = 0; i < empirical.vars.size(); i++) {
01104     int counts = empirical.counts[i/3];
01105     /* empirical variance gets set to zero if there weren't enough
01106        observations for variance estimations (i.e. less than 2). If we
01107        don't have enough observations to compute a variance set the counts
01108        to zero so that we just use the prior estimate of variance. */
01109     if (counts < 2) {
01110       counts = 0;
01111     }
01112     int totalCount = counts + degFree;
01113     double result = ((counts * empirical.vars[i]) +
01114                     (degFree * prior.centerVars.element(i)))/totalCount;
01115     newVar.element(i) = result;
01116   }
01117   return newVar;
01118 }
01119 
01120 /** Wrapper function for getting bayesian adjusted parameters given data. */
01121 ClusterModel QuantBRLMM::fitModel(std::vector<double> &aValues,
01122                                   std::vector<double> &bValues,
01123                                   std::vector<std::vector<double> > &genoDist,
01124                                   std::vector<affx::GType> &genoTypes,
01125                                   ClusterPrior &prior, const std::string &name,
01126                                   BrlmmParam &param) {
01127 
01128   enum Transformation transform = param.m_Transform;
01129   int iterations = param.m_Iterations;
01130   double iterationThreshold = param.m_IterationThreshold;
01131   double K = param.m_K;
01132 
01133   ClusterStats stats = QuantBRLMM::computeClusterStats(aValues, bValues, genoTypes, transform, K );
01134 
01135   ClusterModel model;
01136   ColumnVector newVar = shrinkVariance(stats, prior, param.m_PriorPseudoCount);
01137   model.clusterVars = newVar;
01138   ColumnVector means = columnVectorFromVector(stats.means);
01139   model.clusterMeans = QuantBRLMM::bayesianMeanUpdate(newVar, stats.counts, means, prior.covars, prior.centers);
01140   /* If iterations are greater than zero then we are going to recall
01141      using current model and relearn a new model using those calls
01142      instead of original calls. */
01143   while (iterations > 0) {
01144     iterations--;
01145     vector<affx::GType> newCalls;  // brlmm calls for current iteration.
01146     vector<double> newConfidences; // brlmm confidences for current iteration.
01147     /* Make initial call using current model. */
01148     brlmmCall(aValues, bValues, model, newCalls, newConfidences, genoDist, param);
01149 
01150     /* Set calls that are less than our threshold to NN */
01151     assert(newCalls.size() == newConfidences.size());
01152     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < newCalls.size(); i++) {
01153       if (newConfidences[i] > iterationThreshold) {
01154         newCalls[i] = NN;
01155       }
01156     }
01157     /* Compute a new model with updated calls. */
01158     ClusterStats stats = computeClusterStats(aValues, bValues, newCalls, transform, K);
01159     ColumnVector newVar = shrinkVariance(stats, prior, param.m_PriorPseudoCount);
01160     model.clusterVars = newVar;
01161     ColumnVector means = columnVectorFromVector(stats.means);
01162     model.clusterMeans = QuantBRLMM::bayesianMeanUpdate(newVar, stats.counts, means, prior.covars, prior.centers);
01163   }
01164   return model;
01165 }
01166 
01167 void QuantBRLMM::valueForTransformation(double aVal, double bVal, enum QuantBRLMM::Transformation trans,
01168                                          double K, double &xVal, double &yVal) {
01169   double c = 0.001;
01170   double denom = 0;
01171   double aV = 0.0;
01172   double bV = 0.0;
01173   double r = 0.0;
01174   switch (trans) {
01175   case MvA:
01176     if (aVal == 0) aVal = c;
01177     if (bVal == 0) bVal = c;
01178     xVal = (log2(bVal) + log2(aVal)) / 2;
01179     yVal = log2(bVal) - log2(aVal);
01180     break;
01181   case RvT:
01182     // Check to make sure we're not got to take log of 0
01183     denom = bVal;
01184     if (bVal == 0) bVal = c;
01185     xVal = atan(aVal/ denom);
01186     yVal = log( sqrt((aVal * aVal) + (bVal * bVal) + c) );
01187     break;
01188   case  CES:
01189     // Check to make sure we're not got to take log of 0
01190     denom = bVal + aVal;
01191     if (denom == 0) denom = c;
01192     xVal = sinh( K * (aVal - bVal)/denom) / sinh(K);
01193     yVal = log2(denom);
01194     break;
01195   case CCS:
01196     denom = bVal + aVal;
01197     if (denom == 0) denom = c;
01198     aV = aVal;
01199     if (aV == 0) aV = c;
01200     bV = bVal;
01201     if (bV == 0) bV = c;
01202     r = K * (aV - bV)/denom;
01203     r = log(r + sqrt(r*r+1));
01204     xVal = r / log(K + sqrt(K*K+1));
01205     //r = K * (aV - bV)/denom;
01206     // r = log(r + sqrt(r*r+1));
01207     //    xVal = (log(r + sqrt(r*r+1))) / log(K + sqrt(K*K+1));
01208     // Note that we are using natural logarithm here (log_e), not log2
01209     // xVal = asinh(K * tanh( .5 * (log(aV) - log(bV)))) / asinh(K);
01210     yVal = log2(denom);
01211     break;
01212   default:
01213     Err::errAbort("QuantBRLMM::fillInTransformedData() - Don't recognize transformation type: " + ToStr(trans));
01214   }
01215 }
01216 
01217 /**
01218  * Transform the data in aValues and bValues using the method specified by trans.
01219  *
01220  * @param aValues - Summary values for A allele.
01221  * @param bValues - Summary values for B allele.
01222  * @param genoTypes - Genotypes for each sample.
01223  * @param Transformation - Type of transformation to use.
01224  * @param xDim - two dimensional matrix for x dimension with rows
01225  * (index 0) being genotype (0,1,2) and columns being values observed.
01226  * @param yDim - two dimensional matrix for y dimension with rows
01227  * (index 0) being genotype (0,1,2) and columns being values observed.
01228  */
01229 void QuantBRLMM::fillInTransformedData(std::vector<double> &aValues,
01230                                        std::vector<double> &bValues,
01231                                        std::vector<affx::GType> &genoTypes,
01232                                        enum QuantBRLMM::Transformation trans,
01233                                        double K,
01234                                        std::vector<std::vector<double> > &xDim,
01235                                        std::vector<std::vector<double> > &yDim) {
01236   /* Sanity check. */
01237   assert(aValues.size() == bValues.size());
01238   assert(aValues.size() == genoTypes.size());
01239 
01240   /* Clean out any previous results. */
01241   xDim.clear();
01242   yDim.clear();
01243 
01244   xDim.resize(3); // Number of genotypes 0, 1, 2
01245   yDim.resize(3); // Number of genotypes 0, 1, 2
01246   //  double xVal = 0, yVal = 0;
01247   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < aValues.size(); i++) {
01248     if (genoTypes[i] == NN)
01249       continue;
01250     //    valueForTransformation(aValues[i], bValues[i], trans, K, xVal, yVal);
01251     xDim[genoTypes[i]].push_back( aValues[i] );
01252     yDim[genoTypes[i]].push_back( bValues[i] );
01253   }
01254 }
01255 
01256 /** Count up some elementary statistics about a particular snp over
01257     multiple experiments. */
01258 ClusterStats QuantBRLMM::computeClusterStats(std::vector<double> &aValues,
01259                                              std::vector<double> &bValues,
01260                                              std::vector<affx::GType> &genoTypes,
01261                                              enum QuantBRLMM::Transformation trans,
01262                                              double K) {
01263   // Sanity checks
01264   assert(aValues.size() > 0);
01265   Err::check(aValues.size() == bValues.size(), "computClusterStats() - Expression should be same size.");
01266   Err::check(bValues.size() == genoTypes.size(), "computClusterStats() - Expression should be same size as genotyping.");
01267   // Indexes are AA = 0, AB=1, BB=2 dType = "difference" bType =
01268   // "intensity" Normally these would be M & A (like MA plots), but
01269   // A gets confusing with genotype 'A'
01270   vector<vector <double> > dTypeValues(3);
01271   vector<vector <double> > iTypeValues(3);
01272   //  bool allGood = true;
01273   ClusterStats stats;
01274   // Loop through and group into genotype specific data.
01275   fillInTransformedData(aValues, bValues, genoTypes, trans, K, iTypeValues, dTypeValues);
01276 
01277   // Compute the means of the clusters for each genotype. Note that if
01278   // we don't have enough samples to compute the variance it is set to
01279   // zero as a placeholder, but it is necessary to check the counts
01280   // later to make sure we're not using an invalid number.
01281   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
01282     stats.counts[i] = iTypeValues[i].size();
01283     if (stats.counts[i] > 0) {
01284       stats.mMeans[i] = Average<vector<double>::iterator, double>()(iTypeValues[i].begin(), iTypeValues[i].end());
01285       stats.aMeans[i] = Average<vector<double>::iterator, double>()(dTypeValues[i].begin(), dTypeValues[i].end());
01286       if (stats.counts[i] > 1) {
01287         stats.mVars[i] = UnbiasedVariance<vector<double>::iterator, double>()(iTypeValues[i].begin(), iTypeValues[i].end());
01288         stats.aVars[i] = UnbiasedVariance<vector<double>::iterator, double>()(dTypeValues[i].begin(), dTypeValues[i].end());
01289         stats.covars[i] = UnbiasedCovariance<vector<double>::iterator, double>()(dTypeValues[i].begin(), dTypeValues[i].end(), iTypeValues[i].begin());
01290       }
01291       else {
01292         stats.mVars[i] = 0;
01293         stats.aVars[i] = 0;
01294         stats.covars[i] = 0;
01295       }
01296     }
01297     else {
01298       stats.mMeans[i] = 0;
01299       stats.mVars[i] = 0;
01300       stats.aMeans[i] = 0;
01301       stats.aVars[i] = 0;
01302       stats.covars[i] = 0;
01303     }
01304     stats.means.push_back(stats.mMeans[i]);
01305     stats.means.push_back(stats.aMeans[i]);
01306     stats.vars.push_back(stats.mVars[i]);
01307     stats.vars.push_back(stats.aVars[i]);
01308     stats.vars.push_back(stats.covars[i]);
01309   }
01310   return stats;
01311 }
01312 
01313 /* Make the inverse matrix from the variance and covariances. */
01314 Matrix QuantBRLMM::makeVarInv(Matrix &clusterVars, int index) {
01315   Matrix var(2,2);
01316   index = 3 * index;
01317   var.element(0,0) = clusterVars.element(index,0);
01318   var.element(1,1) = clusterVars.element(index+1,0);
01319   var.element(0,1) = clusterVars.element(index+2,0);
01320   var.element(1,0) = clusterVars.element(index+2,0);
01321   return var.i();
01322 }
01323 
01324 /* Take the model derived in fitModel and use it to do predictions. */
01325 void QuantBRLMM::brlmmCall(const std::vector<double> &aValues,
01326                            const std::vector<double> &bValues,
01327                            ClusterModel &model,
01328                            std::vector<affx::GType> &calls,
01329                            std::vector<double> &confidences,
01330                            std::vector<std::vector<double> > &genoDist,
01331                            BrlmmParam &param)
01332 {
01333   //
01334   assert(aValues.size() > 0);
01335   assert(aValues.size() == bValues.size());
01336   // JHG - debugging
01337   // printVec("aValues",aValues);
01338   // printVec("aValues",bValues);
01339   //
01340   double hetMult = param.m_HetMultiplier;
01341   Matrix obs(aValues.size(),2); // Our observed means in both M and A dimensions.
01342   Matrix distance(aValues.size(),3); // Our distances to clusters.
01343   calls.clear();
01344   confidences.clear();
01345 
01346   /* Load up the observed means into matrix. */
01347   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < aValues.size(); i++) {
01348     obs.element(i, 0) = aValues[i];
01349     obs.element(i, 1) = bValues[i];
01350   }
01351 
01352   /* Calculate the distances for each genotype. */
01353   for (int colIx = 0; colIx < distance.Ncols(); colIx++) {
01354     Matrix varInv = QuantBRLMM::makeVarInv(model.clusterVars, colIx);
01355     // I'm thinking these are the covariances for the mahalanobis distance
01356     double t1 = varInv.element(0,0);
01357     double t2 = varInv.element(0,1) + varInv.element(1,0); /// @todo why is this additive?
01358     double t3 = varInv.element(1,1);
01359 
01360     /* Calculate the distance for different samples for this genotype. */
01361     for (int rowIx = 0; rowIx < distance.Nrows(); rowIx++) {
01362       double iDist =  obs.element(rowIx,0) - model.clusterMeans.element(colIx * 2, 0);
01363       double dDist =  obs.element(rowIx,1) - model.clusterMeans.element(colIx * 2 + 1, 0);
01364       double dist = iDist*iDist*t1 + iDist*dDist*t2 + dDist*dDist*t3;
01365       /* If we are calculating distance for AB genotype (column 1) then multiply by our
01366          het multiplier as a way to balance het/hom accurancy. */
01367       if (colIx == 1) {
01368         dist = dist * hetMult;
01369       }
01370       distance.element(rowIx, colIx) = dist;
01371     }
01372   }
01373   genoDist.resize(distance.Nrows());
01374 
01375   /* for each sample predict based on which cluster is closest. */
01376   for (int rowIx = 0; rowIx < distance.Nrows(); rowIx++) {
01377     double minDistance = FLT_MAX;
01378     int minDistIx = -1;
01379     double secondMin = FLT_MAX;
01380     for (int colIx = 0; colIx < distance.Ncols(); colIx++) {
01381       double dist = distance.element(rowIx, colIx);
01382       genoDist[rowIx].push_back(dist);
01383       // JHG - debug
01384       // printf("dist=%.10f\n",dist);
01385       if (dist < minDistance) {
01386         secondMin = minDistance;
01387         minDistance = dist;
01388         minDistIx = colIx;
01389       }
01390       else if (dist < secondMin) {
01391         secondMin = dist;
01392       }
01393     }
01394     calls.push_back((affx::GType)minDistIx);
01395     confidences.push_back(minDistance/secondMin);
01396   }
01397 }

01399 /**
01400  * @brief Default Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
01401  * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
01402  */
01403 std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> QuantBRLMM::getDefaultDocOptions() {
01404   std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> opts;
01405   SelfDoc::Opt hetMult = {"het-mult", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "1.0", "1.0", "0", "1.0",
01406                           "Number to balance het calls with to balance performance on het/hom calls."};
01407   opts.push_back(hetMult);
01408   SelfDoc::Opt iterations = {"iterations", SelfDoc::Opt::Integer, "0", "0", "0", "NA",
01409                              "Number of times to iterate BRLMM classifier, feeding in new calls from previous iteration."};
01410   opts.push_back(iterations);
01411   SelfDoc::Opt iterThresh = {"iter-thresh", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "0.3", "0.3", "0", "1",
01412                              "Maximum confidence score to use when doing iterations internally [0,1]."};
01413   opts.push_back(iterThresh);
01414   SelfDoc::Opt k = {"K", SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "4.0", "4.0", "0", "NA",
01415                     "Scale parameter used used in CCS and CES transformations."};
01416   opts.push_back(k);
01417   SelfDoc::Opt transform = {"transform", SelfDoc::Opt::String, "CCS", "CCS", "NA", "NA",
01418                             "Transformation of initial data are we feeding into the classifier? {'CCS', 'CES', 'MvA','RvT'}"};
01419   opts.push_back(transform);
01420   SelfDoc::Opt priorWeight = {"prior-weight", SelfDoc::Opt::Integer, "40", "40", "0", "NA",
01421                               "Psuedocount weight should the prior have? Also known as 'degrees of freedom' in R code."};
01422   opts.push_back(priorWeight);
01423   SelfDoc::Opt priorMinCall = {"prior-mincall", SelfDoc::Opt::Integer, "2", "2", "2", "NA",
01424                                "Minimum number of genotypes per cluster for inclusion in prior estimation, must be >= 2."};
01425   opts.push_back(priorMinCall);
01426   SelfDoc::Opt lowprecision = {"lowprecision", SelfDoc::Opt::Boolean, "false", "false", "NA", "NA",
01427                                "R prototype uses summary values rounded to first decimal place. Use this flag to be simulate behavior."};
01428   opts.push_back(lowprecision);
01429  SelfDoc::Opt maxscore = {"MS",SelfDoc::Opt::Float, "0.5","0.5", "0", "2",
01430                                 "Threshold for making no-calls"};
01431         opts.push_back(maxscore);
01432  return opts;
01433 }

01446 /**
01447  * Convert a (text insensitive) text repesentation of a transformation into
01448  * the enumration.
01449  * @param s - string specifying transformation.
01450  * @return - Enumeration version of transformation.
01451  */
01452 enum QuantBRLMM::Transformation QuantBRLMM::transformationForString(const std::string& str) {
01453   std::string lowerS = Util::downcaseString(str);
01454 
01455   if (lowerS == "mva")
01456     return MvA;
01457   else if (lowerS == "rvt")
01458     return RvT;
01459   else if (lowerS == "ssf" || lowerS == "ces")
01460     return CES;
01461   else if (lowerS == "assf" || lowerS == "ccs")
01462     return CCS;
01463   else
01464     Err::errAbort("QuantBRLMM::transformationForString() - Don't recognize transformation: " + str);
01465   return MvA;
01466 }
01467 
01468 /**
01469  * Convert a transformation enum to string representation
01470  * @param t - tranformation enum value.
01471  * @return - text description of enumeration.
01472  */
01473 std::string QuantBRLMM::stringForTransformation(enum QuantBRLMM::Transformation t) {
01474   switch(t) {
01475   case MvA :
01476     return "MvA";
01477     break;
01478   case RvT :
01479     return "RvT";
01480     break;
01481   case CES :
01482     return "CES";
01483     break;
01484   case CCS:
01485     return "CCS";
01486     break;
01487   default:
01488     Err::errAbort("QuantBRLMM::stringForTransformation() - Don't recognize type: " + ToStr(t));
01489   }
01490   Err::errAbort("QuantBRLMM::stringForTransformation() - Should never reach this point.");
01491   return "";
01492 }

01495 /**
01496  * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
01497  * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
01498  * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
01499  * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
01500  *
01501  * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
01502  *
01503  * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
01504  */
01505 SelfCreate *QuantBRLMM::newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param) {
01506   SelfDoc doc = explainSelf();
01507   double hetMult = 1.0, K = 4;
01508   double iterationThreshold = 0.3;
01509   int iterations = 0;
01510   bool lowprecision = false;
01511   enum QuantBRLMM::Transformation transform = CCS;
01512   string transformStr;
01513   map<string,string>::iterator iter;
01514   int priorWeight = 40;
01515   int priorMinCall = 2;
01516   fillInValue(hetMult, "het-mult", param, doc);
01517   fillInValue(iterations, "iterations", param, doc);
01518   fillInValue(iterationThreshold, "iter-thresh", param, doc);
01519   fillInValue(K, "K", param, doc);
01520   fillInValue(transformStr, "transform", param, doc);
01521   transform = transformationForString(transformStr);
01522   fillInValue(priorWeight, "prior-weight", param, doc);
01523   fillInValue(priorMinCall, "prior-mincall", param, doc);
01524   fillInValue(lowprecision, "lowprecision", param, doc);
01525   QuantBRLMM *brlmm = new QuantBRLMM(hetMult, iterations, iterationThreshold, K, transform,
01526                                      priorWeight, priorMinCall, lowprecision);
01527         double score;
01528         fillInValue(score,"MS",param,doc);
01529         brlmm->setMaxScore(score);
01530   return brlmm;
01531 }
